subject: Support image list for deleted images

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think this needs a spec because you've gone beyond the v1 bugfix.  Here's what would need to be dealt with in the spec:

(1) What's the use case for displaying deleted images?  (When I've asked about this feature in the past, the response by former PTLs was: why would anyone want to see deleted images?  It was intentionally left out of v2.)

(2) You say your v2 change will enable the "end user" to list deleted images, but it's hard coded so that you have to have admin context to do this.  Maybe this should be configurable by policy so a provider could allow other end users to do this.  We should see what the community thinks about this.

(3) How are you going to handle the display of deleted items in the image_properties table?  The way the deletions happen in that table, there's no way to distinguish image properties that were intentionally deleted by the user during the lifetime of the image (do not want to display those as part of the deleted image) from image properties that were deleted when the image itself was deleted (would make sense to display these).

Thanks!

Patch Set 2:

Thank you very much for the comments, Brian.

(1) What's the use case for displaying deleted images? (When I've asked about this feature in the past, the response by former PTLs was: why would anyone want to see deleted images? It was intentionally left out of v2.)

Good question. I think most of the time we're confusing the concept 'deleted' in Glance. Like I mentioned in the commit message, we have two attributes/fields related to 'deleted'. 'status' and 'deleted' from the database perspective. It maybe reasonable to hide those images in deleted 'status', but, sometimes, user/operator want to see what happened if a snapshot/image is killed. For now, the image is gone and nobody can't see it unless to dig into the log.


(2) You say your v2 change will enable the "end user" to list deleted images, but it's hard coded so that you have to have admin context to do this. Maybe this should be configurable by policy so a provider could allow other end users to do this. We should see what the community thinks about this.

It's a good point.

(3) How are you going to handle the display of deleted items in the image_properties table? The way the deletions happen in that table, there's no way to distinguish image properties that were intentionally deleted by the user during the lifetime of the image (do not want to display those as part of the deleted image) from image properties that were deleted when the image itself was deleted (would make sense to display these).

I think your point is how to distinguish the properties deleted intentionally by user or deleted associated with the image. I think it's easy to figure out based on the deleted_at field of image and properties if we really want to do that.

FWIW, it's a real requirement from our user. And at least we can provide a config to let admin/operator decide if the deleted images can be accessed or not, instead of just closing the gate. Thoughts?
BTW, I can split this patch into two if that makes any sense for you.

Patch Set 2:

Thanks for your responses, Fei Long.

For (1), I agree that this is a good use case.

For (2), a slight complication that I forgot: as part of the work to provide full support so that nova can use the Images v2 API, we need to support the "changes_since" parameter on the image-list call.  That implies the ability to display deleted images.  I believe that nova uses glance-admin credentials now with v1 in order to be able to retrieve image records with status == 'deleted'.  So I think it would be good to make this functionality available to end-users, because it would be great if nova could make its connection to Glance and do everything it needs to do using the v2 API while using the credentials of the end-user who made the nova call instead of using Glance admin credentials.  Thus, we may *not* want to make this a configuration option, we may want to make the display of deleted images available to all users.

A side question here, what about a call to GET /v2/images/UUID ?  Should that return a 404 or should it return the image record?  (GET /v2/images/UUID/file would still return a 404.)

For (3), I think that for the use case you outlined, it would make sense to have all the image properties that existed at the time the image was deleted included in the response.  An end-user might being using custom metadata that would provide useful information about the deleted image, and it would be good if that were displayed.

Summary: I think your suggestion to split the patch is a good one, you can do one patch to fix the v1 bug, and then we should do a spec for the v2 work because it has a few implications beyond your specific use-case.

Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

I will keep this one to implement this in v2 and submit a new patch to fix the v1 issue.
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Do other projects support this kind of feature? To keep consistency across all components, we should either keep this in all components or in none.

Personally I don't think it is good idea to allow users to query deleted data. The operator would have a different mechanism to understand what happened in the past. That could be log, Ceilometer or the database itself.

Patch Set 3:

Hi Ajaya Agrawal, thanks for the comments. So are you aware of 'nova list --delete'?
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

(-1 on the commit message flags)

Just to be super clear. I'd rather not have this in v1 but - correct me if I'm wrong - I understand that deleted images won't be returned unless the deleted flag is passed. The reason I'm ok with this is that it also helps reducing the difference between both APIs and hopefully make the transition between v1->v2 easier by making it simpler to implement the compatibility layer we need.

Patch Set 3:

Thanks for the review, flaper87. For v1, actually we don't have to add the 'deleted' filter, the deleted image can be shown by filter 'changes-since', but in v2, we're hardcoding filters['deleted'] = False. So IMHO, we're breaking the compatibility between v1 and v2. Even though somebody maybe argue if the deleted images should be known by end users, but I would say why not. I can't see any bad impact. And Nova can also show the deleted instances. Does that answer your question?

Patch Set 3:

That said, I don't mind removing the change for v1 :)

lack of reviews or if you think the patch is still relevant.

forward to have more contributions from you.
